description: go.crypto/ssh/test: wait on sshd process in tests

messages.text:
Hello dave@cheney.net (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.crypto

Hello,

This change looks good. Did it cause a failure in your test environment, or is this just general hygiene ?

Cheers

Dave

On 2013/04/07 08:50:19, dfc wrote:
> Hello,
> This change looks good. Did it cause a failure in your test environment, or is
> this just general hygiene ?
> Cheers

If you have a program that runs the ssh test binary repeatedly, like:

https://github.com/alberts/gostress2

the zombies pile up and you eventually hit your process limit.
LGTM. Thank you for the explanation, I understand the problem now.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=ca43617ec9b3&repo=crypto ***

go.crypto/ssh/test: wait on sshd process in tests

R=dave
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/8449043

Committer: Dave Cheney <dave@cheney.net>

subject: code review 8449043: go.crypto/ssh/test: wait on sshd process in tests
